hook.text: Programs create objects in memory and often forget to clean up after themselves.

buildup.text: Memory leaks happen when unused objects pile up. Eventually the system runs out of memory.

discovery.text: Garbage collectors automatically find and reclaim memory that programs no longer use.

twist.text: GC pauses can freeze your app. Java's infamous 'stop the world' pauses made games stutter.

climax.text: Modern GC algorithms run concurrently, reducing pauses to milliseconds most users never notice.

punchline.text: Automatic cleanup keeps memory from drowning.

quiz.question: What does a garbage collector do?
options: Reclaims memory no longer in use
